To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - look for plenty of Port Jervis/Pascack Valley Line service to get you to your destinations during the long holiday weekend. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. New Haven Line Service Update: Train service to New Haven has resumed with significant delays due to single tracking and train congestion as a result of the failure of a draw bridge in the vicinity of South Norwalk to close properly. Currently there is only one track available for service over the draw bridge. Limited service from New Haven to New York/Grand Central Terminal has also resumed with significant delays up to 90 minutes due to single tracking over the draw bridge. There will be no inbound (to NY) train service at South Norwalk, Rowayton, Darien and Noroton Heights Stations. Customers using those stations should go to Stamford for train service to Grand Central. For Danbury Branch customers, shuttle train service is being provided between Danbury and Merritt 7 Stations due to overhead wire damage. Shuttle bus service is being provided from Merritt 7 to Stamford Station for inbound train service and bus service is being provided from South Norwalk to Merritt 7 Station for connecting train service to Danbury. Customers are strongly encouraged to seek alternate transportation at this time.

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - look for plenty of Port Jervis/Pascack Valley Line service to get you to your destinations during the long holiday weekend. On Monday, May 30, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See more details at http://bit.ly/1JsTb1h

Revised May 15 West- of-Hudson Timetable Now Available

Revised May 15 Port Jervis/Pascack Valley Line timetable now available. Look for the following changes on the Port Jervis Line: The 2:41 PM train from Hoboken will operate making all New York State station stops to Port Jervis on May 27, July 1, and September 2 ONLY. The 6:15 PM train from Hoboken will not operate on May 27, July 1, and September 2 ONLY. For more information, please call 511 or visit http://bit.ly/1pqFXEe to see the timetable.

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - look for early getaway Port Jervis/Pascack Valley Line trains on Friday, May 27 and plenty of service to get you to your destinations during the long holiday weekend. On Monday, May 30, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See more details at http://bit.ly/1JsTb1h

L Line Customers/Canarsie Tunnel Reconstruction Update

Thank you for signing up to receive periodic emails on updates about the L Line Canarsie Tunnel Reconstruction project. This is to inform you that our next public meeting is scheduled for Thursday, May 26th from 7 -9 pm, at Beraca Baptist Church, located at 9602 Flatlands Avenue in Brooklyn, New York. MTA Transit leadership and technical staff will discuss the project and construction options being considered. Customers will have the opportunity to ask questions and provide comments. Please visit http://web.mta.info/sandy/rebuildingCanarsieTunnel.html for details about this critical recovery and resiliency work. Best regards, The L Line Reconstruction Team

Rockville Centre Escalator Replacement to Start

Starting today, a new escalator is being installed at Rockville Centre Station. The adjacent staircase is also being refurbished. During the work, the south side ticket office entrance will not be available for use. Customers should use the elevator on the west side of station building, or the stairways at North Village or North Park Avenue to reach platform level. The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year. Thank you for your patience and understanding while we perform this work.

Metro-North Service Remains Suspended Tonight, Saturday Service Expected on Wed. May 18

Metro-North train service remains suspended into and out of Grand Central this evening (Tues., May 17) because of a fire under the Park Avenue Viaduct at 118th Street in Manhattan. See alternate service plans at http://bit.ly/SeCMH3. Metro-North personnel are working through the night to inspect the structure to determine the extent of the structural damage and make temporary repairs. Until Metro-North determines that it is safe to operate trains over the Viaduct, service into and out of Grand Central Terminal will remain suspended. For tomorrow morning, Wednesday, May 18, Metro-North expects to run Saturday service. Should conditions improve overnight, then the level of train service will be gradually increased for the AM rush. Customers should continue to check the website and news media for any updates & listen for announcements at stations.

To avoid transfers at Jamaica use direct service to/from Atlantic terminal on Hempstead & Far Rockaway branches. LIRR System Network Upgrade 2AM-4AM, Fri. May 6

From 2 AM to 4 AM Fri., May 6, electronic signs at stations systemwide and the LIRR's TrainTime App will not display the STATUS of scheduled trains due to a planned LIRR system network upgrade. The electronic station signs and the TrainTime App will continue to display train schedule times, however the STATUS of those trains will not be available during this 2-hour period.

To avoid transfers at Jamaica use direct service to/from Atlantic terminal on Hempstead & Far Rockaway branches.
